critique: The document expresses sympathy for the widow of a fallen officer and aims to provide her with a position. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is joy for Mrs. Roberts and perhaps a sense of justice or satisfaction in the public. There might also be a touch of sadness for the loss of Mr. Roberts, but the overall tone is positive and supportive. Surprise and fear are not relevant in this context. Disgust is also not relevant. The initial scores are based on this assessment. Upon review, the initial scores seem reasonable, but I will slightly adjust them to better reflect the emphasis on joy and the presence of some sadness.
